segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicating the beginning of the message and identifying the consignment for which status is being requested.
DTM, A segment indicating the date/time of the message and the dates, times and periods relating to the requested status or events.
LOC, A segment identifying a place/location which applies to the consignment such as consignment origin and destination.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify a reference which applies to the whole message, and its related date and time.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify a reference relating to the requested status, e.g. customer reference number. Also a reference to previous message can be given.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relating to the reference.
TDT, A segment identifying conveyance relating to the status or event such as flight, vessel/voyage.
EQD, A segment identifying equipment related to the requested status or event such as a container.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to specify the parties related to the consignment.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying a party to the consignment such as a shipper, consignee, freight forwarder, broker.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to indicate contacts related to the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a department or a person to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to provide information about specific consignments, e.g. included in a consolidation.

segment.documentation: CNI, A segment to indicate a consignment (in a consolidation) using the reference number of its transport document.
DTM, A segment to indicate the date/time of the transport document of this consignment and the dates, times and periods relating to the requested status or events.
LOC, A segment identifying a place/location which applies to the consignment such as consignment origin and destination.
RFF, A segment identifying a reference relating to the requested status, e.g. customer reference number/order.
TDT, A segment identifying conveyance relating to the status or event such as flight, vessel/voyage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to identify equipment and eventually the means of transport in which it is placed.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment identifying equipment related to the requested status or event such as a container.
TPL, A segment to identify a means of transport (e.g. train) to which the equipment is linked.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to specify the parties related to this consignment.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying a party to the consignment such as a shipper, consignee, freight forwarder, broker.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to specify a goods item, necessary in cases where the request concerns only part of the consignment.

segment.documentation: GID, A segment to provide details of a goods item as part of a consignment.
FTX, A segment to describe the goods item.
SGP, A segment to identify equipment in which goods are transported.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to indicate contacts related to the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a department or a person to whom communication should be directed.
